thread.title_full: ‘My Heart Dies Every Time’ - Naomi Osaka Feels Devastated in Heartbreaking Admission on Reaching Peak Playing Again - EssentiallySports

author: Aarav Singh Gill
title: ‘My Heart Dies Every Time’ - Naomi Osaka Feels Devastated in Heartbreaking Admission on Reaching Peak Playing Again - EssentiallySports
text: Debate Can Naomi Osaka overcome her emotional struggles to reclaim her spot at the top? No such thing as a dramatic ending to a player’s post-match presser, right? Well, think again. [Naomi Osaka](https://www.essentiallysports.com/tag/naomi-osaka/) never fails to change that. The Japanese talent has crashed out of the [US Open](https://www.essentiallysports.com/tag/us-open-twenty-twenty-four/), facing an early exit in the event’s second round. However, her recent string of losses elicited her to term how heartbreaking it is for her to endure such premature exits. Having returned to the Tour after her pregnancy hiatus, the former World No. 1 came high-spirited at the Flushing Meadows event. Despite showcasing remarkable progress lately and with it, thwarting Jelena Ostapenko‘s challenge in the opener, Osaka failed. She was thrashed by Karolina Muchova, 6-3, 7-6(5), having displayed commendable resilience in the second set. Later, while talking to the reporters in New York, the Japanese star expressed, “I feel like my heart dies every time I lose.” ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad The four-time Major champion acknowledged that she was a shadow of her former self before stepping onto the sidelines due to her pregnancy. However, Osaka emitted optimism, citing that she ‘feels better’ with her performances and aims to address her emotions whenever suffering a thumping loss as such. ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad She said, “I feel I’m coming back from pregnancy but also it wasn’t like in 2022 I was the best version of myself. In some way, I had to catch up to that and also I’m truly to pass it as the same time. It’s been a little difficult. I feel faster. I feel better. But I lost in the 2nd round so it’s a little rough. It’s tough because I take these losses personally. This is a dramatic word.. but I feel like my heart dies every time I lose. It sucks a lot. But I’ve been trying to be more mature and learn and talk more about them.” What’s your reaction? Naomi Osaka's heartbreaking admission: "My heart dies every time." React! In some way, I had to catch up to that and also I’m truly to pass… [pic.twitter.com/tsDpjLUcRg] — The Tennis Letter (@TheTennisLetter) [August 30, 2024] ADVERTISEMENT Article continues below this ad
